pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.5: 89. The training rule on sitting mats
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.2: he allowed the sitting mat for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.4: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six used sitting mats that were inappropriate in size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.5: The sitting mats hung down from beds and benches, both in front and behind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.6: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.7: “How can the monks from the group of six use such sitting mats?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.11: “… Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.13: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.14.1: ‘If a monk is having a sitting mat made, it is to be made the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.15: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.16: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.17: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1: At that time there was a big monk called Venerable Udāyī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.2: After putting out his sitting mat in front of the Buddha, he stretched it on all sides before sitting down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.4: “Udāyī, why are you stretching the sitting mat on all sides,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.6: “Because, Venerable Sir, the sitting mat you’ve allowed for the monks is too small.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.7: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.8: “Monks, I allow a border of one handspan for the sitting mat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.9: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.10.1: ‘If a monk is having a sitting mat made, it should be made the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.11: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide, and a border of one handspan.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.12: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.2: one with a border is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.4: making it himself or having someone else make it, it should be made the right size.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.5: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide, and a border of one handspan.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.6: If he makes one, or has one made, that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.7: When he obtains it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.8.1: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.9: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.10: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.11: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.12: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.13: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.2: if he makes it the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.3: if he makes it less than the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.4: if he obtains one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts it down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.5: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.8: The seventh rule, the training rule on sitting mats, is finished.
